SEARCH
Package controllers

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
controllers.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class handles the core functionalities of the application. It interacts with the data layer (databases) to perform operations on users, sellers, and activities, as well as other functionalities related to user authentication, querying data, and viewing profiles.

  • Method Details

    • wipeData

      public void wipeData()
      Wipes the data from the User and Seller databases.

    • add

      public void add(User e)
      Adds a User object to the User database.
      Parameters:
      e - The User object to be added.

    • update

      public void update(User e)
      Updates a User object in the User database.
      Parameters:
      e - The User object to be updated.

    • add

      public void add(Seller e)
      Adds a Seller object to the Seller database.
      Parameters:
      e - The Seller object to be added.

    • update

      public void update(Seller e)
      Updates a Seller object in the Seller database. The existing Seller object is removed and then the updated object is added.
      Parameters:
      e - The Seller object to be updated.

    • add

      public void add(Activity e)
      Adds an Activity object to the Activity database.
      Parameters:
      e - The Activity object to be added.

    • authenticateSeller

      public Seller authenticateSeller(String email, String password)
      Authenticates a Seller using the provided email and password. This method attempts to log in a Seller using the provided email and password by calling the login method of the Seller database.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the Seller to be authenticated.
      password - The password of the Seller to be authenticated.
      Returns:
      The authenticated Seller object, or null if authentication fails.

    • authenticateUser

      public User authenticateUser(String email, String password)
      Authenticates a User using the provided email and password. This method attempts to log in a User using the provided email and password by calling the login method of the User database.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the User to be authenticated.
      password - The password of the User to be authenticated.
      Returns:
      The authenticated User object, or null if authentication fails.

    • getUsers

      public List<User> getUsers()
      Retrieves the list of all users from the User database.
      Returns:
      A List containing all User objects stored in the database.

    • queryUser

      public User queryUser(String pseudo)
      Searches for a user in the User database by their pseudo (username).
      Parameters:
      pseudo - The pseudo (username) of the user to search for.
      Returns:
      The User object with the specified pseudo if found, or null if not found.

    • queryUser

      public User queryUser(User user, String pseudo)
      Searches for a user in the list of followers of a specific user.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object representing the specific user whose followers are searched.
      pseudo - The pseudo (username) of the user to search for among the followers.
      Returns:
      The User object with the specified pseudo if found among the followers, or null if not found.

    • viewProfile

      public void viewProfile(User user)
      Displays the profile information of a User. This method prints the pseudo, followers, following, points, and interests of the specified User to the console. This information is not adapted for graphical user interfaces (GUIs).
      Parameters:
      user - The User object whose profile information is to be displayed.

    • getSellers

      public List<Seller> getSellers()
      Retrieves the list of all sellers from the Seller database.
      Returns:
      A List containing all Seller objects stored in the database.

    • querySeller

      public Seller querySeller(String factor, String choice)
      Searches for a seller in the Seller database based on the specified factor and choice.
      Parameters:
      factor - The factor to search for (e.g., name, address, or types of components).
      choice - The choice determining the search criteria (e.g., "1" for name, "2" for address).
      Returns:
      The Seller object matching the specified factor and choice, or null if not found.

    • viewProfile

      public void viewProfile(Seller seller)
      Displays the profile information of a Seller. This method prints the name of the Seller and the names of the components listed by the Seller to the console.
      Parameters:
      seller - The Seller object whose profile information is to be displayed.

    • queryComponent

      public List<Component> queryComponent(String factor, String choice)
      Searches for components in the Seller database based on the specified factor and choice.
      Parameters:
      factor - The factor to search for (e.g., name of the component, type, or name of the supplier).
      choice - The choice determining the search criteria (e.g., "1" for name of the supplier, "2" for name of the component, "3" for type of the component).
      Returns:
      A List of Component objects matching the specified factor and choice, or null if no components are found.

    • getActvities

      public List<Activity> getActvities()
      Retrieves the list of all activities from the Activity database.
      Returns:
      A List containing all Activity objects stored in the database.
